required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open-Label Phase 2 Trial of a Steroid-Free, CNI-Free, Belatacept-Based Immunosuppressive Regimen
clinical_study.official_title: Steroid and Tacrolimus Avoidance Using NULOJIX® (Belatacept) in Renal Transplantation (CTOT-16)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to evaluate a NULOJIX® (belatacept) based regimens as a means of improving long-term graft function without increasing the risks of immunologic graft injury by avoiding both calcineurin inhibitors (CNIs) and corticosteroids.

detailed_description.textblock:
Taking standard anti-rejection medications for a long time can cause serious side effects, including kidney damage. Transplant recipients have to take anti-rejection medications to prevent their immune system (the body's natural defense system against illness) from rejecting their new kidney. Most patients who receive a kidney transplant must take these anti-rejection medications for the rest of their lives, or for as long as the kidney continues to work.
The purpose of this study is to determine if NULOJIX® (belatacept), will minimize serious long term side effects seen with anti-rejection medications while still protecting the transplanted kidney from damage. The researchers also want to learn more about the safety of this treatment and the long term health of the transplanted kidney.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Safety concern:rejection rate disparity between investigational versus control arm. Stopping rule not met.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) By Treatment Group Using the Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration Equation (CKD-EPI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Clinically Suspected and Biopsy Proven Acute Rejection Within the first 52 Weeks-Defined by Histologic Evidence of Rejection and Graft Dysfunction
Proportion of Subjects with eGFR < 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 by CKD-EPI
Change in Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) Stages
secondary_outcome.description: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) stages are defined as follows: Stage 1: GFR of 90+ (normal kidney function but urine findings or structural abnormalities or genetic trait point to kidney disease) Stage 2: GFR of 60-89 (mildly reduced kidney function point to kidney disease) Stage 3A: GFR of 45-59 (moderately reduced kidney function) Stage 3B: GFR of 30-44 (moderately reduced kidney function) Stage 4: GFR of 15-29 (severely reduced kidney function) Stage 5: GFR of <15 (very severe, or endstage kidney failure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects with Defined CKD stage 4 or 5
Mean Calculated eGFR Using Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) 4 Variable Model
Slope of eGFR by CKD-EPI Over Time Based on Serum Creatinine
secondary_outcome.description: Collection schedule per protocol's schedule of events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Delayed Graft Function
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as dialysis in the first week on one or more occasions for any indication other than the treatment of acute hyperkalemia in the setting of otherwise acceptable renal function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Acute Cellular Rejection >/= IA Within the First 52 Weeks
Severity of First and Highest Grade of Acute Cellular Rejection Within the First 52 Weeks
Incidence of Antibody-Mediated Rejection
secondary_outcome.description: Defined by diffusely positive staining for C4d, presence of circulating anti-donor antibodies, and morphologic evidence of acute tissue injury.

secondary_outcome.measure: Type of Treatment of Rejection
secondary_outcome.description: Concomitant medications or therapies to treat the participant's rejection will be summarized by the adverse reaction outcome status. Medications will be defined by each site's standard of care.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of De Novo Anti-Donor Histocompatibility Antigen (HLA) Antibodies
Incidence of New Onset Diabetes Post-Transplant (NODAT) or Impaired Fasting Glucose (IFG)
secondary_outcome.description: Based ADA (American Diabetes Association) and WHO (World Health Organization) Criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treated Diabetes Between Day 14 and Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Treated diabetes is defined as receipt of any oral medication or insulin for the treatment of diabetes for >14 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) Measurements
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, days 28 and 84, and weeks 28, 36 and 52

secondary_outcome.measure: Standardized Blood Pressure Measurement and Use of Anti-Hypertensive Medications
Fasting Lipid Profile and Use of Lipid Lowering Medications
secondary_outcome.description: Total cholesterol, non-high density lipoprotein cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein, high density lipoprotein, and triglyceride.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Daily Prescribed Pill Count
Incidence of Death or Graft Loss
Incidence of Rejection
Incidence of Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
Incidence of Infections Requiring Hospitalization or Systemic Therapy
Incidence of BK Polyoma Virus (BKV) and Cytomegalovirus (CMV) Viremia (local center monitoring)
Incidence of Epstein Barr Virus (EBV) Infection
secondary_outcome.description: As reported on the case report form

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Fever > 39 Celsius (102.2 Fahrenheit) degrees and Blood Pressure < 90mm Hg Within 24 Hours of Onset of Transplant Procedure

arm_group.description: Induction with Thymoglobulin®, methylprednisolone, and maintenance immunosuppression with tacrolimus and mycophenolate mofetil (MMF)
Induction with Thymoglobulin®, methylprednisolone, and maintenance with belatacept and mycophenolate mofetil (MMF)

Induction basiliximab and methylprednisolone, administration of NULOJIX® (belatacept) 24 hours post reperfusion (+/-12 hrs); maintenance immunosuppression with 1. )20 week course of Prograf® (tacrolimus) or equivalent 2.) CellCept® (mycophenolate mofetil- MMF), or Myfortic® (mycophenolate sodium), or equivalent. Subjects participating in this arm may have tacrolimus reinstated, at a dose to be determined by the site investigator, if any of the following events occur: 1 - An acute rejection episode 2- Request of the subject or site Investigator.

intervention.description: The target dosage is 6mg/kg total over 3 to 4 days. The recommended route of administration is intravenous infusion using a high-flow vein.

Participants will receive belatacept at a dose of 10mg/kg up on day 1, 5, 14, 28, 56 and 84. After 84 days, subjects will receive a maintenance dose of 5 mg/kg every 4 weeks until completion of the trial.

Methylprednisolone will be administered at a target dose of 500 mg beginning on the day of transplant, and tapered to 250 mg day 1 post-transplant, 125 mg day 2 post-transplant, 60 mg day 3 post-transplant, 30 mg day 4 post-transplant and day 5 post-transplant 0 mg if therapeutic tacrolimus level achieved for groups 1 and 3.
Basiliximab will be administered in two doses of 20 mg each.

Mycophenolate Mofetil will be administered at a target dose of 1000 mg orally twice a day. Myfortic® (mycophenolate sodium) may be used as a replacement for MMF. Mycophenolate sodium will be dosed at 720 mg PO BID. Mycophenolate sodium will be adjusted based on clinical complications.

The site investigator will identify a starting tacrolimus dose at their discretion, in order to achieve the target trough levels, no later than 5 days post-transplantation. The dose will be adjusted to 5-8ng/ml for the active comparator arm (thymoglobulin + tacrolimus + MMF arm) or tapered off in the experimental arm (basiliximab + 20 weeks of tacrolimus + MMF + belatacept).

link.description: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)
